rubrics.requirements: Core Pipeline Architecture and Processing Model

sub_tasks.requirements: Four-Stage Pipeline Structure (Input → Filter → Output with Codec support)
Input Stage: Event ingestion and generation from diverse data sources
Multi-threaded input processing with lifecycle management (start/stop/awaitStop)
Event queuing and buffering mechanisms
Filter Stage: Sequential data transformation, enrichment, and parsing logic
Event mutation and enrichment processing capabilities
Conditional processing logic and control flow (if/else) for dynamic event routing
Worker threads execute filter stage in topological order with batch processing
Output Stage: Event delivery to external destinations with reliability guarantees
Batched event delivery with acknowledgment and commit mechanisms
Output isolation and error handling patterns
Back-pressure handling and flow control to prevent buffer overflow
Codec Layer: Bidirectional serialization/deserialization between byte streams and Events
Stateless encode/decode operations for data format translation
Codec cloning per-connection for stateful framing (multiline, JSON lines)
Event Data Model and Field Reference System
Event Object: Fundamental, map-like data structure flowing through the pipeline
Type-safe field access and mutation operations via programmatic API
Immutable event structure with controlled mutation capabilities
Field Reference Grammar: Hierarchical field access with bracket notation syntax
Field reference parsing and resolution engine with zero-copy reads
sprintf template engine with field reference interpolation at runtime
Metadata Field (@metadata): Transient data store for conditional logic, excluded from output
Elastic Common Schema (ECS) Compatibility: Event normalization to standardized schema
Pipeline Configuration and Orchestration
Declarative Configuration System: DSL for defining pipeline structure and plugin settings
Configuration parsing into directed acyclic graph of plugin instances
Plugin parameter validation and type coercion
Environment variable substitution and templating support
Multi-Pipeline Execution Engine: Support for multiple concurrent pipelines
Pipeline-to-pipeline communication with internal event routing
Complex routing topologies (distributor, isolator, forked-path patterns)
Pipeline lifecycle management with hot-reloading and graceful shutdown
Dual-Language Plugin Architecture: Ruby and Java plugin development on unified JVM
Plugin Runtime Contract: Minimal lifecycle API (register/run|filter|decode|encode/close)
Plugin Types: Distinct roles (Input, Filter, Output, Codec) with specific interfaces
Configuration schema advertisement and introspection at boot
Ruby Plugin Development Model
Plugin class inheritance with configuration parameter system
Code-generated plugin skeleton and RubyGems packaging
Java Plugin Development Model
Java plugin API with annotation-based configuration
Gradle-based build system with JAR packaging and deployment
Plugin Management and Distribution System
Plugin Manager Utility: Installation, update, and removal of plugins
RubyGems and JAR dependency resolution with proxy support
Offline plugin management and private repository support
Event Buffering and Queue Systems
In-Memory Queue: High-throughput, non-durable buffer for performance-focused use cases
Configurable batch sizes and buffering strategies
Back-pressure mechanisms and flow control
Persistent Queue (PQ): Disk-based, journaled queue with at-least-once delivery guarantees
Page and checkpoint file management for durability across restarts
Queue corruption detection and repair utilities (pqcheck/pqrepair)
Garbage collection and disk space management policies
Dead Letter Queue (DLQ): Error isolation and recovery system
Failed event capture without blocking main pipeline flow
DLQ file rotation, size management, and reprocessing workflows
JVM-based Execution Foundation
Java Virtual Machine runtime with memory and resource management
Heap and off-heap memory allocation strategies
JVM tuning parameters and garbage collection optimization
Worker Thread Management: Parallel event processing with configurable thread pools
Event ordering control and batch processing optimization
Queue wiring between stages with thread orchestration
Process Lifecycle and Dynamic Configuration
Controlled startup and shutdown with event draining to prevent data loss
Dynamic configuration reloading without full service restart
Monitoring and Metrics Collection
REST APIs for querying pipeline performance, throughput, and queue status
Integration with Elastic Stack Monitoring (Metricbeat/Elastic Agent)
Slowlog functionality for performance analysis and debugging
Centralized Management Plane
REST APIs and UI for pipeline definition management
Elasticsearch-based configuration storage and pipeline synchronization
Security and Authentication Framework
Transport Layer Security (TLS/SSL) for encrypted communication
Authentication mechanisms: basic auth, PKI certificates, and API keys
Keystore service for secure credential management with decryption at boot
Logging and Debugging Infrastructure
Log4j2-based logging system with dynamic level control
Multi-Platform Deployment Support
Platform artifacts: tar/zip, deb/rpm packages with service management
Docker containerization with official images and configuration management
Kubernetes orchestration compatibility and Helm chart support
Horizontal Scaling and Distributed Architecture
Multi-instance deployment model for parallel processing
Inter-node communication for tiered architectures (collector/indexer patterns)
